Operation 'getAirTraffic' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_context, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary is generic and doesn't reflect the API's specific purpose (most booked destinations). Description was completely empty, missing critical information about operation purpose, inputs, outputs, and context. Enhanced version clarifies that this retrieves booking analytics for popular destinations, explains the filtering capabilities, specifies the return format, and includes the important caveat about test environment limitations mentioned in the API documentation. This helps AI agents understand when to use this operation (finding popular destinations) and what to expect.

data.current_summary: Returns a list of air traffic reports.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve most booked flight destinations and traffic analytics
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves analytics data on the most booked flight destinations, including air traffic volume and booking trends. This operation returns historical booking data aggregated by destination, helping identify popular travel routes. Accepts filtering parameters for date ranges, origin cities, and other criteria to narrow results. Returns a collection of air traffic records with booking statistics and metadata. Note: Test environment data is limited to selected cities; see data collection documentation for available destinations.
